docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs

docs.text: mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout

docs.text: Python Interview Questions for Data Engineers 🧠 Basics Q1. What are Python's key features? - Interpreted, dynamically typed, object-oriented, open-source, and has extensive libraries. Q2. What’s the difference between is and == in Python? - == compares values, is checks identity (memory location). Q3. How do you swap two variables without a temporary variable? a, b = b, a Q4. What's the difference between a list and a tuple? - Lists are mutable; tuples are immutable and faster. 🧱 Data Structures & Algorithms Q5. How do you implement a queue in Python? from collections import deque queue = deque() queue.append('a') queue.popleft() Q6. How to find duplicates in a list? seen = set() dupes = [x for x in lst if x in seen or seen.add(x)] Q7. What is a dictionary and how is it used? - Key-value mapping. Fast lookups using hash tables. Q8. How do you sort a dictionary by values? sorted_dict = dict(sorted(my_dict.items(), key=lambda item: item[1])) 🔄 Loops & Comprehensions Q9. What is a list comprehension? [x for x in range(10) if x % 2 == 0] Q10. What is a generator? def gen(): for i in range(5): yield i 🗃️ File Handling & Error Handling Q11. How to read a file line by line? with open('file.txt') as f: for line in f: print(line) Q12. How does Python handle exceptions? try: 1/0 except ZeroDivisionError: print("Cannot divide by zero") 📊 Data Analysis (Pandas / NumPy) Q13. How do you handle missing data in pandas? df.dropna(), df.fillna(0) Q14. How to group data in pandas? df.groupby('column').agg({'sales': 'sum'}) Q15. How to filter rows in a DataFrame? df[df['value'] > 100] 🧪 Testing & Functions Q16. What are *args and kwargs in Python?** def func(*args, **kwargs): pass Q17. What is a lambda function? square = lambda x: x*x 🧱 Object-Oriented Programming Q18. What is inheritance? class A: pass class B(A): pass Q19. What is a class method vs static method? @classmethod def cls_method(cls): pass @staticmethod def static_method(): pass 🛠️ Advanced Topics for Data Engineering Q20. What is a Python decorator? def decorator(func): def wrapper(): print("Before") func() print("After") return wrapper Q21. How do you read a large file without loading into memory? with open('large.csv') as f: for line in f: process(line) Q22. What is the GIL in Python? - Global Interpreter Lock prevents multiple native threads from executing Python bytecodes at once. ✅ Tips for Interviews Focus on writing clean and readable code Know common libraries: pandas , numpy , collections , itertools Be able to explain your reasoning out loud
docs.title: Python Interview Questions for Data Engineers
Python Interview Questions for Data Engineers

docs.text: Q1. What are Python's key features? - Interpreted, dynamically typed, object-oriented, open-source, and has extensive libraries. Q2. What’s the difference between is and == in Python? - == compares values, is checks identity (memory location). Q3. How do you swap two variables without a temporary variable? a, b = b, a Q4. What's the difference between a list and a tuple? - Lists are mutable; tuples are immutable and faster.
docs.title: 🧠 Basics

docs.text: Q5. How do you implement a queue in Python? from collections import deque queue = deque() queue.append('a') queue.popleft() Q6. How to find duplicates in a list? seen = set() dupes = [x for x in lst if x in seen or seen.add(x)] Q7. What is a dictionary and how is it used? - Key-value mapping. Fast lookups using hash tables. Q8. How do you sort a dictionary by values? sorted_dict = dict(sorted(my_dict.items(), key=lambda item: item[1]))
docs.title: 🧱 Data Structures & Algorithms

docs.text: Q9. What is a list comprehension? [x for x in range(10) if x % 2 == 0] Q10. What is a generator? def gen(): for i in range(5): yield i
docs.title: 🔄 Loops & Comprehensions

docs.text: Q11. How to read a file line by line? with open('file.txt') as f: for line in f: print(line) Q12. How does Python handle exceptions? try: 1/0 except ZeroDivisionError: print("Cannot divide by zero")
docs.title: 🗃️ File Handling & Error Handling

docs.text: Q13. How do you handle missing data in pandas? df.dropna(), df.fillna(0) Q14. How to group data in pandas? df.groupby('column').agg({'sales': 'sum'}) Q15. How to filter rows in a DataFrame? df[df['value'] > 100]
docs.title: 📊 Data Analysis (Pandas / NumPy)

docs.text: Q16. What are *args and kwargs in Python?** def func(*args, **kwargs): pass Q17. What is a lambda function? square = lambda x: x*x
docs.title: 🧪 Testing & Functions

docs.text: Q18. What is inheritance? class A: pass class B(A): pass Q19. What is a class method vs static method? @classmethod def cls_method(cls): pass @staticmethod def static_method(): pass
docs.title: 🧱 Object-Oriented Programming

docs.text: Q20. What is a Python decorator? def decorator(func): def wrapper(): print("Before") func() print("After") return wrapper Q21. How do you read a large file without loading into memory? with open('large.csv') as f: for line in f: process(line) Q22. What is the GIL in Python? - Global Interpreter Lock prevents multiple native threads from executing Python bytecodes at once.
